title: Geth no longer syncing - peer is unknown or unhealthy?
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 
````
Geth
Version: 1.10.18-stable
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.16.4
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/local/go
````
OS & Version: 
````Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS
Release:        20.04
Codename:       focal
````

Geth Service Parameters: `/eth1/bin/geth --datadir /eth1/data --datadir.ancient /mnt/nas/data --port 30303 --mainnet --syncmode snap --txlookuplimit=0 --cache.preimages --cache=32768 --ws --ws.addr 192.168.6.10 --ws.port 8546 --ws.api web3,eth,txpool,admin,net,personal --graphql --http --http.addr 192.168.6.10  --http.vhosts '*' --http.api web3,eth,txpool,admin,net,personal`

Storage: 
/eth1 = NVME
/mnt/nas = Synology RAID

````
Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
/dev/sdb1       938G  282G  609G  32% /eth1
````
````
Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
/dev/sdc1       8.0T  337G  7.3T   5% /mnt/nas
````

Process:
```` 
PID USER      PR  NI    VIRT    RES    SHR S  %CPU  %MEM     TIME+ COMMAND
    931 root      20   0   47.4g  30.0g  16720 S   8.2  47.8  31385:04 geth
````

Memory:
````
              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:          64263       31582        1244          13       31436       31957
Swap:          4095           4        4091
````


#### Expected behaviour

- Geth keeps syncing

#### Actual behaviour

- Geth stuck at block 15050009 (Fri Jul 01 2022 04:02:55 GMT-0400 (EDT))
- I have not yet tried restarting the service

````
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 15050009,
  healedBytecodeBytes: 0,
  healedBytecodes: 0,
  healedTrienodeBytes: 0,
  healedTrienodes: 0,
  healingBytecode: 0,
  healingTrienodes: 0,
  highestBlock: 15066940,
  startingBlock: 15049998,
  syncedAccountBytes: 0,
  syncedAccounts: 0,
  syncedBytecodeBytes: 0,
  syncedBytecodes: 0,
  syncedStorage: 0,
  syncedStorageBytes: 0
}
````

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

- Not sure how it got stuck, it just getting interesting bad block messages on June 30th
- Attached are geth logs starting on June 30th through today


[geth.zip](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/9047682/geth.zip)
Can you please share your logs as text on this thread?

I'll share some snippets, as there is a 65536 character limit

Working snippet before noticable issues:
